餕字的基本解释

餕
jùn
见“馂”。

餕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jùn］
［《廣韻》子峻切，去稕，精。］
“馂1”的繁体字。
(1)吃别人剩下的食物。
(2)泛指进餐。
(3)吃后剩下的食物。
(4)指祭品。
(5)通“飧1”。

餕字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【食字部】　餕； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1420第14
【唐韻】子峻切【集韻】【韻會】祖峻切，?音俊。【玉篇】熟食也。【說文】食之餘也。【禮·內則】父母在，朝夕恆食，子婦佐餕，旣食恆餕，父沒母存，冢子御食，羣子婦佐餕如初，旨甘柔滑，孺子餕。【註】佐餕，勸父母再食，子婦始食。餕，旣盡也，盡食其所餘也。御食者恐父母獨食心傷，故侍之食也。旨甘，如棗栗飴蜜之類，能調衆味，故如孺子之餕，以頤養老人也。　又祭畢食神之餘。【禮·祭統】古之君子曰：尸亦餕鬼神之餘也，惠術也，可以觀政矣。　又凡食人之餘，及日晚食饌之餘，皆云餕。【禮·玉藻】日中而餕。【註】餕，食朝之餘也。　又【集韻】疾眷切，泉去聲。義同。　【六書故】亦作?。

餕字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
餕字的起名意思

暂无。

remains of a meal
Basic explanation of words
remains of a meal
jùn
See "Fang".
remains of a meal
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jùn］
["Guangyun" sub-junk cut, go to 稕, fine. ]
Traditional characters for "馂1".
(1) Eat leftover food from others.
(2) Refers to meals in general.
(3) Food left after eating.
(4) Refers to sacrifices.
(5) Pass "Zhao 1".
remains of a meal
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【戌集下】【Food Character Department】　餕; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1420-14
[Tang Yun] Zi Jun cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Zu Jun cut,? Yin Jun. 【Jade articles】Cooked food too. [Said the text] I am eating away. [Rite and Nei Ze] Parents are there, always eat day and night, sons and wives are eaten, eat constantly, fathers do not have mothers, mounds are imperial food, groups of sons and wives are the same as before, and the purpose is sweet and smooth, and the children are gluttonous. [Note] As a supplement, persuade the parents to eat again, and the wife begins to eat. Noodles, deplete, eat all the rest. Imperial eaters fear that their parents will eat alone and are heartbroken, so the food is also served. The purpose is sweet, such as jujube, chestnut and sweet honey, which can adjust the taste, so it is like the glutton of the child, to provide for the elderly.　I have sacrificed to the God of Cookery again. [Ritual·JiTong] The ancient gentleman said: The corpse is also a glutton of ghosts and gods, and Huishu is also a way to observe politics.　Every time you can eat people, and eat food every day and evening, you will all be gluttonous. [Li·Yuzao] The Japanese are gluttonous. [Note] Noodles, but also to eat.　[Jiyun] I am sick, and the spring is gone. The same meaning.　[The Story of Six Books] is also made?.
